Entries.DialogueText: A day can never be boring when you follow the whims of your imagination.
Sorry, am I babbling on about nonsense?
Another year gone by, another gray hair... I suppose this gift can commemorate my decline.
I'm honored that you would remember my birthday! Thank you!
Agh, it's still wriggling! Get that abomination away from me!
This will make a beautiful quill! I feel inspired already...
Ah, a bottle of fine ink. A writer can never have too much... and it's quite expensive! Thank you!
Ah, what a gift! The aroma alone is inspiring...
Ah, a book... Yes, perhaps the prose within these pages will offer a new insight. Thank you.
Ah, you've been doing some beach combing... A fine hobby! Thank you.
Ah... the wilted bouquet. A sight I'd hoped to never see...
I suppose there are other horizons to set my eyes upon...
I only wish I had given you a bouquet first!
whispers a sweet secret into your ear.
Why do you torment me? Can't you see you've shattered all my hopes and dreams?
Go away. I can't bear to see you.
... I was worried you might not feel this way about another man.
So am I.
Oh! I'm so sorry.
Mystery, huh? It's definitely an exciting genre. I'll remember that.
Ah, one of the classic genres. I'll remember that.
I would've never guessed! I suppose even those of the 'earthiest' profession sometimes have their heads in the stars.
I'll remember that.
Well...okay.
Here's to !
That's a great idea!
Here's to us!
Hmmph...forget it.
Ah, to a harmonious future for the community... what a virtuous idea.
Here's to Pelican Town!
You've been very helpful... Now, I must think...
I had a good time at the saloon the other day... Though my liver is not quite so enthusiastic...
My legs are stiff from sitting at my writing desk all morning.
, when you're around... I feel unusually creative.
I know... strange, but it's true.
My legs are stiff from sitting at my writing desk all night.
Sometimes I envy you, .
Hello .
Make sure and take breaks from your work now and then.
Come visit me if you need a break from your labors.
I'm usually at my house.
It gets windy this time of year. Marvelous!
I have to remember to water my plants today. And not with sea water this time!
Oh dear! A tiny crab appears to have made his home in my shirt pocket.
That's the trouble with living on the beach.
It's been said that a pirate's ship, full of plundered gold, shipwrecked here a long time ago.
, I was just thinking about you.
Maybe you sensed it.
So! Tell me about your day.
I wouldn't mind trying my hand at farming.
The quiet atmosphere of a farm might be a good source of literary inspiration, don't you think?
Ah... please excuse the mess in my cabin. I wasn't expecting anyone to enter!
Of course... it would be an honor! I look forward to it.
Yes... could I refuse that soft, kind face? The touch of spring-time's sweet embrace?
Excuse me... not today.
The fresh air of this valley is good for body and mind.
A quick stroll outdoors always invigorates me.
Ah... do not get too close to my hair with a torch...
I'll admit... it takes me several hours each morning to make my hair look this good.
Let's not get in a tizzy, now... Gus! I propose a round of drinks to settle the nerves!
Ah, yet another unique day in the valley. Stimulating, to say the least!
Ah, the new farmer we've all been expecting... and whose arrival has sparked many a conversation!
I'm Elliott... I live in the little cabin by the beach. It's a pleasure to meet you.
You've plucked Pelican Town's finest flower... Now, you must care for it with all your heart.
I'm kind of new to this town myself, but I really feel at home.
I moved here only a year before you.
I hope you've come to think of this place as 'home'.
Did you know? A duck's feather makes for an excellent quill.
I must admit, this beach blows my own humble strand out of the water.
Oh dear! Some seaweed has tangled itself in my hair.
That's the trouble with relaxing on the beach.
Gus, I'll order a round for everyone!
*hic*... Oh... I don't have the G.
Heh heh... Never mind!
I'm just taking a quick break to slather some coconut oil on my body.
That was quite the ride!
I'll see you back in the valley.
Hopefully a crab hasn't snuck onto my clothes again.
Imagine crawling out of a pocket and finding yourself on a beach hundreds of miles from home!
Hmmm... Perhaps this could make for an interesting novel...
I've heard rumors of pirates coming to shore near here at night. They say it can get pretty wild!
You probably wouldn't like it inside my cabin. It's dark and full of spiders.
Please excuse the sorry state of my cabin.
Some people are shy. Keep showing interest in them and they'll get comfortable around you.
Everyone likes to have friends, even that grumpy blacksmith.
You've hurt me beyond measure... but I'm willing to leave the past behind us.
It's rare to see so many people at the beach. All for the love of squid!
? You look puzzled.
I guess the hot summer air can make us a little dizzy.
A gentle little sunbeam woke me up this morning. I've never felt so refreshed.
I'm sorry if that isn't very interesting to you.
I know that I am kind of an 'oddball'.
I hope you don't mind.
, I know you have faith in my abilities as a writer. That means a lot to me.
The sun is angry today... My skin is a bit too delicate, I'm afraid.
You came all the way here just to talk to me? How kind.
Visit my cabin whenever you like. I could use the company.
Oh dear! My shoes are filled with sand.
I've encountered some beautiful shells in front of my house.
I would imagine the rarer varieties to be quite valuable.
I write in hopes of connecting with others through time and space.
*sigh*...times are changing, though. People don't read anymore.
It must be satisfying to follow your crop from seed to harvest.
It's as if your essence is infused into the fruit.
Hello. I hope your new farming life is panning out as you'd hoped?
Oh, ! I was hoping you'd show up.
It's always a pleasure to see you.
Hello, .
Are you well?
I can't seem to find the inspiration to begin writing my novel...
I've been feeling hopeful lately. Perhaps the weather is changing.
Sometimes I wonder if I might just have an inflated self-image and no real skills...
No, no... I'm not fishing for compliments. Though they are appreciated...
It's a little lonely out here on the beach... so I apologize if I was ever a little too forward with you when we first met. I was just eager to have a friend.
It feels good to have a close friend like you.
A great idea can pass through your head when you least expect it... but if your mind is too busy you might miss it.
Well, I really must get back to my work.
The sweet friction of pen and paper is the music of my soul.
That's why I chose this beach as my home, so that I could have peace and quiet to do my work.
The forest is a wonderful place. Have you been there?
Sorry, I'm feeling morose today.
I wish there was more certainty about the future.
I don't want to grow old as a lonely hermit on this beach...
I have to brush my hair daily, or else it'll clump up into messy knots.
It's a lot of work.
I'm surprised I haven't just shaved it off in a fit of passion.
I suppose I am too vain.
You've come to visit me in the cold?
I could do with a respite from my lonely labors.
, you've trudged through the snow to visit me?
I'm honored!
I've been doing little indoor exercises, since it's often too cold to go out.
Sorry if it's a little humid in the cabin.
I really should scrub my floorboards today. I think an algae is starting to form.
Do you make time for cleaning?
Breathe deeply. Do you notice it? That's the smell of the sea.
How does it make you feel?
Whenever I smell the sea, it reminds me of my youth. The ocean really impressed me as a child.
People have scraped a living off the sea for thousands of years.
I just go to the grocery store.
, I had a feeling that you would show up.
Perhaps we're connected by an other-worldly thread.
Well, if it isn't the town's number one ice fisher! That was truly an impressive performance.
I never stand a chance, but I always participate just to be sporting.
The farm will be such a lovely place to write. I'm really looking forward to this.
We're going to make a great pair.
This is going to be such an adventure! I'm really excited. Aren't you?
We can use my cottage as a beach house.
, you made it!
I feel so relieved to be done with my book... it's like an elephant's been lifted off my shoulders.
Well, I'd better get started with the reading... Wish me luck.
Good afternoon, everyone.
Ever since I was a young boy, I've dreamt of becoming a writer.

When the time came for me to leave home and start my own life, I moved here. I was drawn to the peaceful beauty of the valley, and hoped that days of quiet reflection in this idyllic atmosphere would fan the literary flames.

After countless hours scribbling at my writing desk, I present to you my first novel: 'The Rise And Fall Of Planet Yazzo'... It's a sci-fi epic spanning thousands of years in an exotic planetary system.
Chapter One.

Commander Yutkin stepped through the golden archway as the airlock snapped shut behind him. Today was his first day on Planet Yazzo, and all 14 of the alliance delegates had been summoned to the Grand Spire...
...And as the 7th moon descended beneath the horizon, the planet of Yazzo would begin its sinister transformation... an event for which Commander Yutkin was completely unprepared.
Well, that concludes my reading. I'll be selling signed copies of the book by the front desk. Thanks for listening!
Well, how was it?
Thanks.
You know, I got the idea for making a sci-fi book from you. Do you remember?
That's why I've dedicated this book to you...
After countless hours scribbling at my writing desk, I present to you my first book: 'Blue Tower'... It's a mystery novel set in a surreal, dystopian future.
From the shadows emerged a man, radiating with enigmatic omniscience. 'Good Evening, Mr. Lu,' he said, the corners of his mouth quivering. Lu seemed astonished. 'How did you know my name?'
Lu checked Jenu's pockets, then stood up and walked into the bedroom. He quickly found the small golden key that he was looking for and slipped it into his coat pocket.
You know, I got the idea for making a mystery from you. Do you remember?

After countless hours scribbling at my writing desk, I present to you my first novel: 'Camellia Station'... It's a romance novel about a train stewardess who falls in love with a traveling architect...

'Your ticket, sir?' Ticket collector Gozman extended a gloved hand towards the young commuter. 'Ah, yes. I have it right here,' he replied, reaching into his coat pocket. Mortified, he discovered that the ticket was missing.

...'Clara, there's something I must tell you,' he blurted as she turned to leave. Clara turned, slowly, and saw the look of desperation in Horatio's eye. At that moment Gozman burst into the compartment, red-faced.
You know, I got the idea for writing a romance novel from you. Do you remember?
Hey.
Look... I fixed up that old rowboat that's been sitting by my house. Pretty nice, huh?
We'd better head back before the southern wind picks up.
Uh oh... The vibration from your body has caught the attention of a Crimsonfish... We'd better get out of here.
Look at the valley from here... it finally looks like 'Home'.
*sigh*... What a day...
... Would you do me the honor of joining me for her maiden voyage?
So my book's been out for a while now... It's not a best-seller or anything, but it's been getting some good reviews from the critics.
And I really couldn't have finished it without your moral support.
Actually, that's not true at all. I would've finished it either way.
But I am grateful that you believed in me... in my vision. And, well...
Um... ? How do I say this...
Well, we've been friends for a while now... But I'm... I'm not sure if I feel that way about you anymore.
No! I'm not saying I want to cut all ties with you!
In fact... quite the opposite.
...Let's see, how do I put this...?
For once, I'm at a loss for words...
-1 null -1 50 event_boat1 -1 -50 event_boat2#You're making me very uncomfortable. Stop.
Get in the boat?No
I see.
! Come in.
Welcome to my humble... well, shack.
This is my writing desk. It's where I spend most of my time.
For as long as I can remember, I've wanted to be a writer. Have I told you that?
That's why I live out here by myself. I figured a lonely life by the sea would help me focus on my literary aspirations...
Everyone back home said I was nuts... that I could never make it as a writer.
Can you believe it? They said 'For every successful author there's 1000 who fail miserably'. Such pessimism... it's sickening.
I can see it in your eyes... you believe in me, . You've got that spark.
Now that's inspiring! That's what I'm looking for...
958699 null 958699 30 event_idea1 958700 30 event_idea2 958701 30 event_idea3#Sci-Fi
Well! Enough talk about me!
Hmm... you probably know a lot about plants, don't you?
Would you mind taking a look at this rose, here? I'm afraid it's not doing so well.
Thanks for talking with me... I'll be thinking about what you said.
Ah... I thought someone was there.
Thank you. I'm not very good, but it's fun to play.
How long have you been playing?
I've been working day and night to try and finish my book... It's been driving me insane, .
An occasional tune is the only recreation I allow myself.
There's just too much work to do! And my bank account's starting to run dry.
Sometimes I wish I could just throw it all away and become a farmer like you.
You're right... that was an insensitive thing to say.
What I meant is that I'd like to get away from this dark, musty prison and experience a little bit of real life... that's all.
*sigh*... sorry I'm complaining like this. I just need someone to talk to now and then.
Come live on the farm, I could use the extra help.
Seriously?
It sounds wonderful... but I can't give up on my novel. It's already half-way done.
Oh, I'm not sure... I've been dabbling in piano since I was a kid.
I'm not very good, but it's fun.
! I've just received the most exciting news!
It's very short notice... but I've been invited to do a reading tour for my book, ''!
...I'll be out of town for a week. Will you be okay?
I leave early tomorrow morning...
I need to pack!
I'll miss you very much, my dear.
And I'll write to you every day, of course!
Hah... good one. Now, don't get too excited...
I'll be sure to write to you every day. I'll miss you!
But, my dear... This is a rare opportunity for me. I must go!
Please don't make me feel guilty about this. I'll write to you every day, and I'll be back before you know it.
Don't let me forget my hairbrush, my hairspray, my fine-tooth comb, and my pomegranate conditioner!
... I'm back...
Ah... I've missed you.
One drop of the big city and I'm quenched... I much prefer being back here with you!
Well, I guess it's back to the old routine once again!
I've got some chores to catch up on...
It's good to be back...

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Saloon/195013/f Shane 2500/f Sebastian 2500/f Sam 2500/f Harvey 2500/f Alex 2500/f Elliott 2500/o Abigail/o Penny/o Leah/o Emily/o Maru/o Haley/o Shane/o Harvey/o Sebastian/o Sam/o Elliott/o Alex/e 911526/e 528052/e 9581348/e 43/e 384882/e 233104/k 195099_1
Entries.DialogueText: Absolutely.

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Saloon/195099/f Shane 2500/f Sebastian 2500/f Sam 2500/f Harvey 2500/f Alex 2500/f Elliott 2500/o Abigail/o Penny/o Leah/o Emily/o Maru/o Haley/o Shane/o Harvey/o Sebastian/o Sam/o Elliott/o Alex/e 911526/e 528052/e 9581348/e 43/e 384882/e 233104/i 446/k 195013
Entries.DialogueText: Don't worry, I've never played before, either.
Hello, ! What a pleasant surprise!
I was just stopping in to relax after an eight hour writing session.
Bartender! Two of your finest ales, please!
Bartender! Fetch me your finest ale. And bring some wine for the lady!
28376 null 28376 25 event_toast4 28376 50 event_toast2 28376 -10 event_toast1 28376 -50 event_toast3#To your doom!
*Hic*... Strong stuff...
Don't blame others for your mistakes! You're just losing more respect with us...
I saw that Pierre had fresh {2} in the shop the other day! Marvelous. It smelled just perfect... and firm, too!
Heh... it just dawned on me...
We've reached the summit, but not just physically... metaphorically as well.
How poetic!
The smokey aroma drew me here, yet 'twas the zesty sauce that truly sealed my fate... *gurgle*
I'm trying to get Gus to tell me his sauce recipe, but he won't budge.
Victory! I achieved a score of '216' with five fish caught... a new personal best!Now, I must choose a fitting prize to purchase for you with these star tokens...
Ah, don't mind the smell... I just emerged from the fishing booth with a sizable haul!Now, I must decide what to do with all these star tokens...
Mmph... I believe I've eaten a few too many slices of pumpkin pie.
Why, hello . It's chilly, isn't it?
I shudder to think what would happen if these got loose...Fear not, my dear! I would run the cursed wretch through, before it could lay a finger on you.
Oh pitiful wretch... in what fetid grotto lies your kingdom?Sometimes, one must stare into the abyss to stir a languid muse...
I enjoy seeing you so relaxed, my dear.
Taking breaks from work can make you more productive in the long run.
Be careful you don't accidentally take a raven's egg. They'll hold a grudge against you for the rest of their days!
I wore my best shirt for the dance... This sort of thing doesn't happen very often!
May I have this dance?
To dance among a whimsical backdrop of flowers is an uplifting experience.
The old cabin seems to be holding up well. Every time I return I half expect the thing to be rotted...
I woke up late, stepped out of the door and found myself in the middle of all this hubbub!I forgot that today was the Luau.
I would suggest we make time for a little 'rendezvous' in my old cabin... but I'm afraid it's become rather... musty... in my absence.
Ah, the Luau... all the hustle and bustle of town brought to my very doorstep!
If we keep polluting the oceans, the jellies will surely go extinct. It's already in the process of happening.What a shame... we have no respect for nature anymore.
Ah, I was wondering when you would arrive!Let's head to the docks soon, and welcome our aquatic guests!
The candle lights shimmering on the water are simply breathtaking. It looks like a painting coming to life.
You don't need to get me anything, you've already given me the greatest gift of all...
My dear, I require nothing at all on this day... you are already the greatest gift a man could hope for.
*urp*Ahh... excuse me. Where are my manners? This spiced cider has quite a potent fizz to it.
I know you'll beat me in the fishing competition, but I don't mind. I'm just here for the fun of it.
I'm entering the ice fishing competition today. Why not?It's rare that Willy ever loses, though.
I've been practicing my fishing technique. I won't hold back against you, my dear.
Look here, it's my secret weapon... a flask of fine spirits, to wet my lips a moment before the whistle sounds...
, this is a beautiful gift! Thank you!
This is for me? Marvelous!
Hmm... I'm not a huge fan of this.
This item gives me a terrible feeling. I'll have to dispose of it.
Oh, a present! Thank you!
